member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthCheckRegistration.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the individual delay applied to the health check after the application starts before executing instances. The delay is applied once at startup, and does not apply to subsequent iterations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus
member.summary: Represents the reported status of a health check result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Degraded
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was in a degraded state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Healthy
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was healthy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Unhealthy
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was unhealthy, or an unhandled exception was thrown while executing the health check.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.IHealthCheck
member.summary: Represents a health check, which can be used to check the status of a component in the application, such as a backend service, database or some internal state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.IHealthCheck.CheckHealthAsync(Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthCheckContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the health check, returning the status of the component being checked.
member.param: A context object associated with the current execution.
A that can be used to cancel the health check.
member.exception: The cancellation token was canceled. This exception is stored into the returned task.
member.returns: A that completes when the health check has finished, yielding the status of the component being checked.
